reviews: Despite being set in one of those large American style outdoor home centre  shopping malls, XS Espresso manages to maintain a funky vibe.
The other upside is that there is plenty of parking.
Food is fresh and colourful, and yes, those freak shakes are as sweet and over the top as they appear on instagram.
My go to for açai bowls!
Much cheaper if you get it take away.
I like to get it without honey.
Lines can be long on the weekend so get in early or wait for a weekday!
After a long awaited dining experience we decided to try XS as it was the talk of town for the past year.
We ordered breakfast meals for lunch and they were delicious.
Of course, while you visit XS you have to try one of their shakes.
We ordered the one with a cronut and most of it seems like just a waste of food.
Mostly for decoration purposes rather than consumption, because sweetness is an understatement for how sweet the overall drink is.
Did not see any customers finish any of their shakes at all.
The shake is not the most appetizing.
The shake itself is pretty to look at.
Customer service is basically nonexistent in this cafe as well.
Desserts and drinks are good.
Other food is alright.
Services are quite bad.
Staff just stood there chatting and ignored customers.
One waitress walked around, sipping a drink she made for herself while seating customers.
I have never seen staff eating pastry while taking order behind counter elsewhere.
The staff working at XS Espresso need a great deal of training in customer service.
Visited this place for dinner at a time when the cafe was not busy at all, and there were a few staff members waiting around with seemingly very little to do.
The staff member who greeted us was unfriendly and seemed annoyed as if we were a complete inconvenience to her.
We were given the drinks menu and told the dinner menu would be given to us in a "few minutes."
This was fine, as we knew it was still early and they had just finished their lunch service for the day.
However, 20 minutes went by and we still had not received the menus.
The waitress was too busy cleaning the floor for the entire time instead of attending to us, so we had to approach her to ask for the menus.
The food itself was fine (although there was no WOW factor), however the staff look so glum and uninviting that I won't be coming here again.
Your food and cutlery is dumped on the table, and no one bothers to check up on you to ask how your meal is.
Very poor customer service, this place is overhyped and would probably only appeal to those who come for an instagram snap.
The owner should probably consider hiring some new staff who actually look like they want to be there!
I am a big fan of the desserts and coffee here.
If you are after something indulgent i am sure you will find something very filling and satisfying here
Beware, the desserts are very over the top and sweet (but that is the fun of it).
The savoury dishes I have tried, including the pizza and fries are OK but would more stick to the desserts.
A small cafe far out in Wetherill Park, with indoor and outdoor seating, XS Espresso is a sleeping giant housing friendly staff and delicious food.
XS has Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner menus ready and waiting!
We could not go past the amazing XS Shakes!
They are famous and crazy overloaded with chocolate, ice cream, cookies and so much more!
The savoury food was well cooked and delivered on flavour.
Highlights were the Chicken and Waffles, Pan Seared Atlantic Salmon and Nonna’s Seafood Pasta.
The sweet items are on another level!!
We recommend the XS Stack, XS Ricotta Hotcake and Açai Bowls.
The desserts were totally gorgeous, not overly sweet and very well balanced.
Worth revisiting again and again, is only for their  overloaded shakes!
We ordered 2 acai bowls without honey and they were really yummy because I don't enjoy the banana overload that most acai bowls have.
Fruit was fresh also.
Food came out quick.
However, the menu says they cost $12.50 each (eat-in) and we paid $14 each because they "increased the price in their system."
Disappointing because they should change the price on their menu beforehand rather than have us wait in line and tell us when we reach the counter.
We went on a Friday at 1.30pm not too busy and not hard to find parking.
I came here with high expectations.
First of all, the decoration and atmosphere is cozy and nice.
Props to that.
The service, not so much.
How can you eat the dessert on top of a milkshake without a spoon?
I ordered the chocolate souffle shake (volcano?), and I regretted it after one sip.
The souffle was already sickeningly sweet and adding to that with the nutella loaded shake just made it bad.
I am disappointed.
Nothing special.
I've been here a few times, although seems to be a local favourite.
The ACAI bowl is very watery and WAY too sweet, go somewhere else if you are thinking of ordering this.
Other than that, the breakfast foods are nothing special, better to save your money and make it at home.
Their shakes are not that great either, even though they look amazing they just taste like milk.
Overall this cafe is overrated and there's no WOW factor.
We Had a terrible Experience Here.
It was Stuff Up After Stuff Up
XS Espresso is a funky cafe located at Wetherill Park and Parramatta.
Drinks need improvement.
Fried chicken was nice.
They serve breakfast until 4pm, monster shakes and a variety of desserts on the menu and in the window display cabinet.
The Wetherill Park cafe is small with seating inside and limited seating outside.
The days that I have gone past, it has been busy.
You order and pay at the counter.
Not ideal for parents with prams, high chairs are available.
We came for lunch and luckily being a Monday, we were quickly seated inside.
Some days you have to wait to be seated.
Staff seemed friendly.
We ordered to eat a Chicken and Waffle and Angry Bird Burger.
To drink, we ordered an iced coffee and berry blast (cold pressed).
The food surprisingly came out first before the drinks.
We did not have to wait too long for the food which is a good thing when you are dining with children.
It was a bit cramped with the high chair and I felt like we were seated too close to the next table as we could hear their conversation.
The Chicken and waffle was something I've heard about but never tried yet intrigued to try.
At first glance, I thought I ordered the wrong meal as I was expecting just chicken and waffle.
There was a tower of salad, cream slaw and fried sweet potato strips on top of my fried buttermilk chicken and cinnamon waffle.
It also came with cheese, maple bacon, and XS secret sauce.
It was well presented but was not sure where to start.
The slaw on its own was a bit too creamy for my liking.
When the salad was mixed properly together, it tasted nice as the fried sweet potato strips gave the salad some texture.
The fried chicken was crispy, soft, juicy and tasty.
The maple bacon was crispy and was not bad.
The sauce was nice and spicy.
The cinnamon waffle was crispy and soft on the inside.
I think I prefer chicken and salad on its own and not with the waffles.
After a while, I was a bit over the sweet waffles.
It was a nice combination at first.
The Angry Bird burger came with fried buttermilk chicken, maple bacon, cheese, iceberg lettuce, tomato, jalapeno relish, and XS secret sauce.
It also came with a side of fries.
It tasted similar to the Chicken and Waffle.
The vegetables were fresh.
The jalapeno relish was not very spicy, I like things spicy.
The milk bun was soft.
The burger just messy to eat and there was way too much sauce.
The burger was nice.
The fries was too salty.
The fries were cooked well, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
We had to tap off the salt on most pieces.
The iced coffee looked yummy with the cream on top.
The white chocolate rim looked gross as there was a blob of chocolate on the side.
It was disappointing.
It had no flavour.
I only chose the cold pressed berry blast drink as the milkshakes would have been sickeningly sweet.
The slice of orange on top was a turnoff.
It tasted nice with mixed berries, watermelon and orange.
I had to remove it as they either cut it early in the morning or the day before as the white part of the orange peel was shrivled up.
Verdict: Come early for a seat or expect to wait.
The fried buttermilk chicken was the standout part of our meals that we most enjoyed followed by the fries.
Came here especially to enjoy their freaky shake.
I came during brunch time on Saturday so they are pretty busy and I had to put my name in the waiting list.
I ordered their original cronut shake.
The cronut shake is really good.
The shake itself is thick and full of flavour.
Sweet of course but not sickly sweet (what a relieve!).
The cronut is pretty good too.
The whole dessert looks epic and insta worthy.
Not going to lie, went here solely to indulge in the original cronut shake so I can not comment on the proper brunch or savoury items.
The cafe is quite lively and despite a lot of bad reviews on service, we didn't have much issues getting served.
As for the shake, it is very rich and basically a sweetness overload.
For remainder of the shake, I was not even halfway through it, and started to struggle.
The cronut was yummy.
Even for someone who has a major sweet tooth, it later it just became too sickening to even finish.
The shake is pretty overrated for what it is.
I recommend getting this instagramable shake as a one time cheat meal.
Recently came here because of all the hype surrounding the cafe.
Walked 15 minutes to reach the cafe to find the food was mediocre.
We ordered three drinks one being warm ??
Ordered another drink which was 15$ to have an average drink with kinder surprise and some fairy floss.
Honestly you could make the drink at home !!
Personally the cafe was quite squishy.
Food here is not great.
Me and my friend ordered chicken nachos, chips with some sauce and Nutella pizza.
Nachos were so dry, the sauce on the chips were cold and the chips weren’t hot at all, the Nutella pizza was okay just got sickening after eating too much.
Acai bowl was quite delicious and actually satisfied my hungry brunch stomach more than I thought it would.
Came out super quick.
The salad was missing the halloumi (main reason why the dish was ordered) and replaced with potato gems.
When the waitress was advised about this, she stated that they had run out and proceeded to call the manager who never came.
I personally would not pay that price for potato gems mixed through kale.
The dish was also slow to come out.
Ambience: I have to say, the ambience was quite nice.
The ambience is nice enough for us to continue chatting away and totally forget about the halloumi ordeal.
So we got here and it was just starting to get busy.
The music inside is quite loud so everyone is speaking louder which I found a little annoying.
We ordered salad only.
We tried to order juice but they said they ran out.
We waited half an hour for the salad to come out.
That is a long time.
The place seemed disorganised.
I saw some people behind the counter using gloves while others were snacking from the fruit bar.
Also some staff are coming out and hugging people, just looked so confusing.
The desserts looked like they were coming out fast.
Maybe order that if you decide to come.
My salad was the first one on their list.
The corn chips tasted not nice, kinda too hard and there was quite a bit of raw onion that seemed to overpower everything else.
Also they forgot to put dressing on my salad.
My friend ordered the second one on the list.
They remembered dressing on his and it tasted much better.
I almost wanted to swap.
Anyway I did not enjoy the night at all and will not be back.
That second salad was nice though so that's the positive.
Been here a few times and all times I have been disappointed with the food and service.
Interior and decoration is nice.
Not sure if I want to come back to try any other breakfast dishes .
Ordered the Benedict and chose salmon.
The broccolini and spinach water soaked the bread and the result was a soggy bun.
The coffee was great but I physically couldn't eat the burger / Benedict and gave it away.
I feel the Benedict is entirely a basic breakfast food and this really failed to live up to any expectations.
The vibe was bustling but it was definitely a cafe where presentation meant more than food quality.
Partner also had the Xs stack and his avocado was mostly a chunk and a little bit mashed ?
Attention to detail was severely lacking .
Recently I watched a YouTube video where the YouTuber said that Guylian Belgian drinks are better than Starbucks.
So I decided to try Guylian for the first time!
I ordered their chocolate shake.
It was very sweet and tasty, however there wasn’t a wow factor.
I wish they had more of a drink selection.
I feel like Starbucks has more of a selection so I would rather go to Starbucks than Guylian.....
Coffees were good.
Hot chocolates were good.
Vanilla shake was good.
My napolean dessert was good.
There was however a very unfortunate smell that ruined much of the mood that seemed to come from the toilets which were right next door.
Service was friendly, but we were confused when we were served with empty cups and small steel pots with the hot beverages, i guess we werent used to it.
The dessert was quite tasty and I would probably have it again.
(7/10) Had an amazing Belgian chocolate milkshake that I could only hope for more of; went down in a matter of seconds!
Would be great if it were just a dollar or two cheaper given this, and as good as the chocolate is, it is still no match for Lindt cafe shakes which are around the same price.
Regardless, some quality milkshakes on offer.
The desserts unfortunately do not stand out to me.
The desserts that are displayed on the front counter are quite pleasant.
My favourite would be the white chocolate passion fruit one, but they all seem to have very similar textures and flavours.
Me, a waffle fanatic, had to try out theirs.
To my surprise the star of the show here was the vanilla ice cream that came with it.
Never have I tried ice cream so creamy and rich with vanilla flavour.
The waffle lacked the soft fluffiness that I personally enjoy.
The waffle itself was very crunchy in texture.
It was a nice experience but I probably would not come back if there were other dessert places around.
Absolutely delicious desserts at Guylian Belgian Chocolate Cafe in Westfield Pitt Street Mall.
With many chocolate options on offer we went with the Iced Chocolate and the Belgian Waffles with Chocolate Drizzle and Vanilla Bean Ice Cream.
The Iced Chocolate was very similar tasting to what is on offer at Oliver Brown.
It was incredibly sweet but still very delicious.
The Belgian Waffles was a lightly toasted waffle served with milk chocolate and vanilla bean ice cream.
The combination of the waffle, chocolate and ice cream instantly melted in your mouth.
The serving size was definitely enough for 2 people if you just want a bit of a taste.
I highly recommend the Guylian Belgian Chocolate Cafe at Westfield Pitt Street Mall if you are in the area.
Looking forward to trying some of their other options here and at other franchises.
There are not that many seats
Ordered Guylian Creme Brulee Tart which was okay.
The chocolate was good and yummy and the hazelnut on top was good as well but for me it was an okay tart
Guylian is well known for its chocolates, and over recent years Guylian cafes have been popping up in Australia serving up chocolate desserts and milkshakes and other delicious chocolatey goodness.
We tried 3 different chocolate entrement cakes, a chocolate mousse cake, a black forest and a chocolate cheesecake.
The black forest was probably my favourite.
The mousse cake was not bad, but it just was not anything spectacular.
The chocolate cheesecake was extremely dense and way too rich for my liking.
Honestly at $14 each the desserts were overpriced and underwhelming.
There are definitely better desserts out there at more reasonable prices.
Score is for the chai latte only.
Sickly sweet, probably from a syrup.
Also tried the apple crumble which was also too sweet.
Very friendly service at the counter.
They have opened up where Happy Labs used to be and there is limited seating in the cafe but you can always sit in the common food court.
There was only one cook and we had went in a group so probably that was overwhelming.
But the place had seating for a lot lot more.
So this one is on the manager not the cook.
The decoration is really nice though.
Very hipster.
There is outdoor and indoor seating available.
Went to the Chatswood one, which has been closed down.
Great service and the food was amazing.
I really enjoyed my time, and it’s really unfortunate that the Chatswood place has closed down.
Cockroaches everywhere.
Dishes and CUPS aren’t clean.
Food is average cafe food.
One of the WORST cafés in Rhodes, thought I could never go wrong in this area, but I was proven wrong.
The avocado was the pasty type, which probably is not real avocado!
I give it that the poached egg was good.
really disappointed with this place.
Take away Piccolo only from this shop.
I can taste they are light medium roasting, and it taste fine by me.
my preference is dark roast .
We had the Rhodes roll (broken omelette with maple bacon) and the Truffle mushroom for breakfast.
The Rhodes roll was awesome, big serving with a side of sweet potato fries.
The Truffle mushroom was so so in taste only.
They also serve a dark soul latte, essentially a black sesame latte.
Glad more cafes are serving this drink, my favourite
Lid and Jar has the best Mocha in Rhodes!
They have got the combination of chocolate and coffee just right!
However, $4 for a small one might be a little bit on the expensive side.
I ordered for vegetarian French Toast which was good.
It could have been better, but I really liked the presentation.
This cafe has really nice music and the staff is really nice.
They have a decent variety for vegetarians and a good seating area, just a one minute walk from the station it is an expensive grab and go Cafe option!
Some tasteless scrambled egg placed inside an uncrunchy croissant.
There was some cherry tomatoes, single slice of swiss cheese and smoked salmon.
I do not think its worth the $12, nor did i come back to this cafe.
From memory, their service was not exactly friendly.
I’m pretty sure I saw the staff pour a can of sprite into the cup to go for their ‘lemonade’.
Anyway, they are one of the convenient places open relatively late in the area so I guess you don’t have much of a choice if you’re after dessert later in the night.
The honey macadamia cheese cake was fairly decent, and they have a fair few other cheesecake options as well.
Staff mentioned the cookies and cream would be a good choice.
This is one of the few establishments on the block that is open past 10pm on a Saturday night.
And this is despite the Pokemon collecting crowds that have recently descended on Rhodes and are occupying the parks and waterfront.
We had a matcha green tea latte, hot chocolate and cronut.
The friendliest of staff in not so busy locale.
A great place to watch the world go by  on an overcast and dreary day.
Lid and Jar has an edgy steam punk industrial style in its decoration.
It is very spacious with its cavernous ceiling very few tables.
The food was great, affordable, and the servings were perfect (for people who find they can never finish their food).
Service was fast, and the friendliness was like that made you feel at home.
Coffee was exceptional.
Definitely a must try when you are next in Rhodes.
I ordered a takeaway iced mocha which tasted very dilute.
Upon finishing I noticed the cup was half-filled with ice, which is disappointing.
Your average brunch place that serves up good coffee and food.
Food and coffee service was fast, water and cutlery is self serve.
I have had better fritters at other cafés but these were still tasty.
Had breakfast this morning with friends, ordered the mushroom dish which came with a black hair on the toast.
The meal was promptly replaced by staff but I did not love he flavors on the plate.
Bit bland and the watercress looked rather sad!
Coffee was ok and the nutella cronut was nice.
Sorry but i do not want to see all the unorganised and unorderly cafe stuff and amenities.
Uncomfortable seating arrangements.
Cute cafe.
Staff were friendly, coffee good but not great, food was ok.
But salty.
I wanted to try the French toast, but I ended up getting the eggs Benedict instead with a cup of mocha.
The food came not long after my coffee arrived.
The meal looked encouraging as the presentation was very nice with its caviar sprinkles and purple flower garnish.
It tasted ok.
I will still come back, but I will probably go for the French toast next time
Nice place to go for casual cafe food.
Most of the food is cooked prior and reheated on a hot plate.
I would much prefer freshly cooked food.
It tastes good.

Always great coffee with fantastic service with a smile, breakfast also really good with a lot of options and always changing probably the best breakfast in Rhodes, definitely worth a try close to the station
Lid and Jar is a nice place to go for some good quality brunch and coffee.
Staff were very friendly and the interior of this place also looks really modern and clean.
I used to go to the one in Chatswood, but luckily found Lid and Jar in Rhodes as well!!
It is just 1 minute from Rhodes station.
I had been here many many times!!
I ordered Croissant with Salmon and Avo dish so far.
Those were tasty and amazing.
The Croissant is very soft and delicious, Veggie, fruit and Salmon were fresh and yummy!
Ordered Watermelon salad as well.
I have never tried ham and cheese with Watermelon but found those were good match:)
Always lovely staff are welcoming, like them and the chilled ambience.
About coffee, I think the barista has been changed several times.
I like the coffee 4-5 months ago than now.
It used to be stronger and tasty tbh.
And I liked the cute latte art before they did.
This place holds a special place in my heart for personal reasons, it is cute like a button and has comfortable booths you can snug in for hours with a beautiful Italian coffee and lovely retro feel.
I love the cakes there, particularly the lemon meringue tart which is storeys high
A bit on the pricey side but open till late in charming surroundings.
I just ordered these after a great meal in another place.
These are toblerone cheesecake, tiramisu and a long black.
Long black came exactly like that.
Imagine the taste.
Just had a sip absolutely, awful.
Ok they might have a bad quality of coffee what about sweets, toblerone cheesecake has no toblerone at all, on the other hand they used cheap chocolate.
Tiramisu was dry and the worst which I ever in my life.
The Rocks Cafe is an amazing combination of Amazing Italian food, friendly staff and reasonably priced Comfort food at a great location.
Just do what the street from the Opera House, there is outside seating.
We had the Fish and Chips, King prawn and chorizo risotto, Napolitano Spaghetti and Chicken and Mushrooms with spaghetti.
Every dish was delicious and so fresh.
We had the cheesecake of the day with a serve of vanilla ice cream and 3 home made lemon and mint iced tea.
Highly recommend the tea as it was really refreshing.
The vanilla ice cream was rich in texture and was packed with vanilla beans which was visible.
The cheesecake was a bit too eggy for my liking.
The cheesecake itself was nice, creamy and smooth.
Although it is pricy, ~$35 for small portions, it was worth it due to the great customer service, location and ambience.
Great food, well prepared and served with a friendly smile from our waitress.
A welcome change from the overpriced Sydney restaurants providing mediocre food.
Took more than 30 mins for a simple order to arrive of burger.
Once it arrived the brioche bun was not fresh and the burger dry.
The fries were mediocre.
Service was slow.
Whilst visiting from interstate we dined here on Saturday morning for breakfast before heading to The Rocks market.
I enjoyed the ham and cheese croissant and hubby enjoyed avocado on toast.
Both meals were tasty and our female server was very friendly and welcoming.
We sat outside which was nice.
A great little place for breakfast.
Went here for lunch after arriving in Sydney.
We sat outside but not know the sun.
The service was not ok. We needed to clarify our order as it was not written down correctly.
We had the rocks burger and the omelette.
I would have liked my pattie to be more cooked as it was quite pink inside.
I felt it was a little overpriced for what it was.
My female server was an absolute delight, she was extremely open and friendly which made me feel very welcomed.
The cakes are lovely, go for the tiramisu.
LOVE the Homemade lemon and mint ice tea, do recommend that.
Very attentive and courteous staff who not only look after you but know their menu and happy to assist in choice.
Very enjoyable experience and food top grade.
A must visit when in the rocks
Came here for a quick lunch, to grab a couple of burgers and cokes.
I asked for my burger with salad instead of chips and they were happy to oblige.
Service was alright and the food was okay.
Nothing exciting but it was lovely sitting outside in the sun!
Nestled in the heart of the Rocks this place caters for all appetites, from a coffee and cake to a full meal.
We have been on three occasions now and have never been disappointed, the range of desserts is a standout.
Staff were friendly.
Fruit toast was burnt.
Tried the kangaroo Burger here!
Came with chips as well but for the price, was not too worth it.
At least I got try try kangaroo while in Australia though!
However the service is great and is situated near the Harbour area!
Service is so slow and bad.
Serving people who is here later and getting their coffees and meals much earlier than you is not simply unacceptable.
Later we found out they forgot our order but instead of admitting it, they lied and said the kitchen is busy.
Everyone who came after us had already eaten and left and we are still here waiting!
So been here twice.
I have noticed that the staff do not listen to what you say.
Lemon meringue pie will come to your table with the top off.
Been there a few times! It is a nice place for an outing.
And when I told the manager he changed it right away and got me another drink.
Really friendly staff and their food is really good...
I came here following a lead from last year Sydney Aroma Festival booklet that mentioned The Rocks Café use signature, premium coffee beans.
They were also finalists in last years event so I had to give them a shot.
I must say the coffee was amazing, it is been a long time since I have had a strong Piccolo Latte that was not over extracted, bitter, lukewarm or using last week stale beans.
I rated this coffee amongst my all time top 10, bear in mind this includes the heavy weights such as the one I had at the Piazza San Marco in Venice.
Anyway, back to The Rocks Café, I also decided to try their delicious Apple Crumble which that was filled with fresh crunchy apples and the exact mix of cinnamon.
My partner also had a skim latte (which is rather difficult to ensure it remains creamy) and a Blueberry Cheesecake, again, well done.
Great desserts and coffee!
I came here with a group of around 12 people, we were desperate for some post dinner dessert and despite its small capacity, the staff were incredibly welcoming and accommodating.
Enjoyed this place!
Great staff and service.
Weather was dicey,  and they said we could sit outside and they would move us in if it rained,  which they did.
Had the kangaroo burger which was tasty,  and my fiance had the all day breakie,  which was great!
The desserts were all on display in a case by the door and looked amazing,  so we had some.
Excellent blueberry cheesecake!
Yes,  a bit pricey,  but we expected that.
Love this spot so much!
Great vibes, lovely service!
Food is okay, and perhaps smaller portions than some inner west cafe but all in all, would totally recommend!
Suggest you call to book where poss!
Thank you waterfront cafe
My family have been frequent visitors to Waterfront for the past three years, always seeming to fall more and more in love with the place with each visit.
The past two meals, however, have not been so great.
the battered fish a chewy and oily mess.
the squid was inedible as it was so overcooked
prawn cutlets seemed a little off.
A lemon wedge was not even put on my plate!
Not sure if it's pure mid week laziness or if the quality has dropped as the popularity has risen.
awesome place
amazing food
friendly environment
beautiful flowers and lovely smell of the candles and reliable cost of food, wanna buy some more candles in my next visit.
loved the nature, sorroundings and enjoyed the live music on sunday.
caring attitude of each and every staff.
the cocktails were amazing.
Gorgeous water front Italian restaurant.
We were lucky to score a table by the sea.
Fortunately we were given blankets because the seating, although undercover, was outside and freezing cold.
There was live music, mostly 80/90 Aus rock, which was fantastic, many people got up to dance by the stage.
We had pizza, prawn linguine and calamari.
As well as a flourless chocolate cake, Tiramisu and crème brûlée.
The food service was speedy, our meals came within 10 minutes.
The pizzas were fabulous (which was expected at an Italian restaurant) as was the pasta.
The desserts were amazing, could not get enough of the Tiramisu!
the only thing I was picky about was the music which was way too loud.
With a stunning view and brilliant food
I understand that a lot of the people were there to enjoy the tunes but we were there for a social family dinner which was deemed impossible unless you felt like yelling to the person next to you.
Definitely will come back.
I sat in the salty subtle sea spray on my 1999 tinny.
I braved the ocean canal and my spiritual soul landed at the waterfront restaurant.
The waves rocked off my tinny as I embarked on an astonishing 5 meter walk to the restaurant entrance.
The location of dining was full of love making couple and an occasional family embracing the true spirit of Italia cuisine in Sydney's mid-north east.
Just after good Friday, I hoed into a palatable morsel inspired by Jesus himself.
Bless my soul, my holy soul!
I had the 'Risotto Nero' a squid ink based risotto that captured the true essence of why I live: splendid food.
It was the best risotto I have consumed.
I guzzled down a short water and then flowed into dessert mode.
I ordered three dishes from the outlet of the lord: tiramisu, ricotta and pear tart and a lemon tart.
All were unique and fascinated my mind with their simpler yet complex form combined with subtlety.
Before I hopped on my tinny I embraced the local general store.
Unfortunately, prices were unmarked and made up on the spot like a dog enforcing the law.
I was ripped on an Easter egg for AUS$3.
What a sin!
Overall, it was a strapping restaurant and I will be returning in the near future to indulge myself again.
The location is obviously great!
But we had a great time at dinner.
The food was great!
The host was very friendly and the wait staff were attentive.
Will definitely visit again.
I came here with my sister.
My sited came before had fresh prawns and said they where to die for,
We shared white sangria which was a little bland and not much flavour!
We also had a share plate for two, over all was nice the out standing part was the oysters and arancini was the stand outs.
The squid was a little blend would of been after with just salt and pepper and where a little soggy.
The prawns where chewy
When u ask for a desert menu the bring over all these sample cakes to chose from it is very confronting
Awesome waterfront view, just happened there was a bushfire in distance, at the time we were there.
pasta and risotto were very oily, struggled to finish off the dish.
Tasty food
Most of the main course food were pretty pricy.
Friendly staff, good location, felt like a small getaway, quite isolated from Sydney hustle and bustle.
And they have live music on certain day of the week.
Great view, but that was about it.
Knowing it was Father's Day I figured that they were pretty busy and so I could understand the lengthy wait for either seats or meals ordered.
The waitress advised that there were seats available but we would have to wait for over an hour for a meal as there were a lot of people already waiting.
But if we wanted sandwiches or pies we can get it straight away.
I wanted to order a meat pie and a sausage roll but we were told by another lady it was also an hour wait to heat them up.
So we just ordered two sandwiches which to be honest they did not seem that fresh.
My partner sandwich looked like it was a day old
But to be frank I was not satisfied and I went in and got a snickers bar.
I would like to try some of their cooked meals and see how it goes but at this time I was not totally impressed.
Extremely disappointing.
Mothers Day is busy for hospitality but that is no excuse for the staff being rude.
Half an hour wait for our reservation, an hour to get our coffees and an hour and a half to get our food, all to be told that they needed is to leave as soon as finished as they needed the table.
What a waste of a great location.
Looking for a place for a soft drink/light snack.
We'd had meals there before which were very nice, but we sat outside on one of the tables with an umbrella looking across the water to Scotland Island.
Went in and ordered 4 sausage rolls and 3 soft drinks.
Were advised that there was a "on the deck" surcharge of $2.
I think someone there has seen an opportunity to screw more money out of their customers, it is their loss because we would not be going back there.
So watch out if you want to sit outside!
What a great spot for a Sunday arvo, beautiful view, chill out atmosphere and great food.
The Osso Buco Alla Milanese is just delicious, highly recommended
Such a waste of a great location.

The Waterfront Cafe is woefully mismanaged, and it shows in the appalling lack of staff morale, the greedy way the tables are jammed in, and often the complete inability to accept a reservation, take an order or deliver a meal.
Utterly hopeless
We had a beautiful dinner here.
Maitre de was very welcoming and funny and made our experience even more relaxing.
The location perfect and food delicious.
The serving sizes were generous and we would definitely return.
I have eaten at many cafes in Australia and around the world and I can honestly say that the big breakfast at Church Point is the BEST I have ever had.
The coffee is great the service polite and the staff are not 10 year old's that can not hold a conversation if you desire one.
As for the owner she could be everyone's grandmother.
Just a great start to the day.
Busy and delightful restaurant.
This cafe is one of the most beautiful places I have been to in Sydney.
I happened to have lunch there on a busy Sunday afternoon which meant the restaurant was full for the entire duration of the lunch.
I will absolutely go again and love the restaurant.

Despite the restaurant being full, I waited a reasonable time for the meals which were delicious once they arrived and the floor staff were attentive and doing their best to accomodate us although they were very busy.
Beer cheaper than small soft drink.
Poor rude service on mothers day.
One of the biggest days for cafe's and restaurants and the staff and service was horrible.
the customer is always rite policy definitely doesn't apply for this place, if you wish to be rushed and rudley/ forcefully presented with your main meals then this is the place for you.
my mother just wanted a nice mothersday at this lovely little cafe and it was rudley refused.
everything was fine untill our mains came, we hadnt even gotten through half our entrees and our table of 5 was still full of plates.
3 of their waitresses brought out the mains without seeing if we were ready for them and forced us to remove all the entrée s on our own accord.

we told the staff that we were still eating our entrees and could you please wait untill we are ready, there response was we are busy and cant take the food back to the kitchen, we asked them to clear the table first and they then rudley accepted for myself to clear it for them and pass them the plates of empty food as they handed me the mains for me to place them down myself.
I have never been to a place that charges 30-40 for an entree and expects their customers to remove the plates and put down the mains them selves.

my mothers other half then had to ask for fresh cutlery to eat with for the mains and the response from the waitress was said with such an attitude like she didnt want to be there she said ( just wait a minute) without a polite word in her vocabulary.

he then had enough and yelled out where the f is the manager, the owner then came to the table and we asked if she wanted to know the problem and she rudley refused to find out the problem and asked us to leave.
she walked of in a hurry and came back with the main meals money, as she pased the money she said you's can now leave.
we happily left to place this review.

such a nice little cafe yet such rude service, if the owner reads this I strongly recommend that you get your staff some professional training in serving your customers as many people say the same thing.
Great location, not so great staff or food.
I love this place.
Have loved it since I was a kid and was so excited when I saw someone put some love into the place and give it a new lease of life.
For a wihle the food, staff and environment were fantastic
The place is now jam-packed with chairs trying to earn every single $ possible.
So hard to get in and out that we decided not to go back and order cakes and coffees after our meals.
Food was quite good - when it eventually came.
My partner ordered eggs with a side of bacon.
The bacon went to another table and when we asked about it, it was our fault.
He finally got this after he'd finished his meal.
We decided we wouldnt go back there again despite living just around the corner from it.
I'd be prepared to pay a little more and have some space and good service.
Why the horrible attitude?.
Such rude staff including the chef.
Everything seemed to be a problem.
I have given this place quite a few opportunities, but they just never cease to disappoint.
The food is incredibly overpriced, but I can take that.
The food is never consistent, sometimes its good and sometimes its average, I can take that.
But what I can't take is the incredibly rude attitude of the staff, including all the young servers.
Its just such a disappointment as this place has so much potential to be great.
The location in and of itself.
A friend mentioned to me that this place over the years just can't get it right when it comes to service.
Disappointing all round.
People just remember your patrons matter.
I liked that the Tearooms had a variety of savoury and sweet pastries.
The setting of the table was very pretty and the tea selection was great too.
We were in the area so stopped for lunch.
The garden was beautiful.
We were not a fan of the decor inside the tea house.
Most of the patrons were having high tea but we were time short so opted for a burger and the chicken salad.
Overall food was ok but overpriced (guess we were paying for the view).
Ingredients were definitely very fresh and seemed to have been grown at the vaucluse house garden.
I came here yesterday afternoon for high tea.
The location is really stunning and idyllic.
We were seated promptly even though we didn't have a reservation.
The high tea looked impressive.
But the savoury options were so so and the cakes were a bit too sweet for my liking and not as amazing as I expected them to be.
The standout however were the scones and clotted cream.
The service at the beginning was very attentive.
However it took a long time to catch the attention of the waitstaff to pay the bill.
Had high tea on a wednesday afternoon, the place was quite hidden but very pretty.
Ordered the high tea set and we got some pastries, sparkling wine and tea and/or coffee.
The high tea was accompanied with good music which was very relaxing.
A very good place to escape the busy city of sydney.
Location was 100/100.
The savoury pastries were mostly good.
The scones was also pretty good.
However the sweet pastries on the very bottom are all very sweet.
The sweet pastries could be improved much better.
We went here for high tea.
I have been to a few in Europe.
The selection of cakes and sandwiches was very poor.
Sausage rolls might be something Australians likes but it does NOT belong on the tea tray!
The chicken spread on white bread was served in a lump and tasteless.
The mini pie was nice.
No little patisseries only dry pieces of cakes and merengue.
My friends from Sweden and I was very disappointed.
Nice ambience when the weather is lovely.
Menu choices is not extensive but alright and bonus with kids choice too.
Nothing much to complain about this place and I would recommend for high tea that starts at 12pm-3pm
This is a gorgeous place to enjoy high tea in gorgeous surrounds without the fuss or pretentiousness of other establishments.
Vaucluse House Tea rooms eschews vintage, feminine sheike.
The food is wonderful, with the elderflower cheesecake doughnuts with strawberry sugar being particularly scrumptious.
While the tea selection isn't as impressive as other venues, the service, food and location more than make up for it however with the high tea service is unlimited.
The Vaucluse House Tearooms also offer wine and French Champagne if you're feeling the need to whet the whistle.
Overall the Tearoom proves simplicity and quality make for a delightful venue.
Well worth a look if you need to treat yourself to some old worldly charm.
Such a lovely house and a wonderful, traditional high tea!
Potentially one of the best high tea experiences I've had in Sydney.
I especially enjoyed the scones.
Drop in this Tearooms with my family after visiting Vaucluse House, the famous "High Tea" was sold out.
Staffs made mistakes on our simple order of coffee, chip and kid lunch.
After an hour wait and an order enquiry, we got a pack of juice, another order enquiry 10 mins later got us two coffees.
We decided to leave this nice tearooms with a hungry family.
Nice settings and good menu, but the food never turns up.
Worst High Tea Experience Ever!
Bring your own food if you got kids with you to this tearooms, the services was totally unacceptable.
Great place for friends gather, food is not bad, services is nice.
The environment is just great!
Highly recommended for especially girls talks!
Went there on a quiet day for dessert.
It is a pretty tea house inside the park, nice and relaxed atmosphere.
It was also lovely to stroll around the area after meal.
The dessert was fantastic,  tasty,  fresh (they used ingredients from what they grow in their garden).
Just felt like those freshly home-made dessert,  loved it!
We used the table on the balcony,  that was a really small table and the food came in big plates, so that was a bit of struggle to fit all the plates in it.
Otherwise,  everything else was good,  the waitress was friendly too.
I didn't say anything at the time and we all ordered a variety of food, coffee and tea and it was a lovely setting and food was average standard.
waiters attitude which really irked me.
I've been to a lot of cafes, tea rooms, restaurants etc, around Australia and the world and normally a simple thing such as sharing a plate of food is seen as acceptable, not my cup of tea
reminded me of the Seinfeld episode with the Soup Nazi
Had a great high tea experience yesterday here after taking a tour of the Vaucluse house.
We showed up more than an hour early for the booking we had made and the staff were very accommodating and got us seated quickly.
Pretty great setting out on the patio in the shade on a hot day.
We really enjoyed the foot brought out.
I thought that the sandwiches were ok, but the rest of the savory and sweet offerings was really good.
Would definitely recommend.
Old school.
Sometimes it's not just about the food.
Sometimes it's about a perfect Sydney day, blue skies and green lawns stretching into the distance.
Cream tea on the terrace, old fashioned china and vintage style.
If any of that strikes a chord, then Vaucluse House Tearooms, a Sydney institution since the 1940s, could be just the place for you.
I brought my mum here as a birthday treat and it was perfect.
We ordered the Devonshire tea, $16 per head for a generous serving of scones with jam and cream and bottomless tea, and luxuriated in the old fashioned charm of the tea rooms.
As it was such a lovely day we sat on the terrace.
On a colder day, the indoor tea rooms would be great, with their banquette seating or bentwood chairs, and expansive views onto Vaucluse Park.
If you do decide to come to the tearooms, Vaucluse House itself is well worth a visit
it really gives a sense of early Australia, the story of the Wentworth family is fascinating, and the rambling rooms are gorgeously furnished.
I saw the reviews were mixed on these tearooms.
Our experience was very good, the service was friendly and efficient, the scones were perfect for the place
although next time I would ask that they not be heated, as they do it in a microwave which is kind of an abominable way to treat a scone really.
But all up, a wonderful experience, and somewhere that really has a strong sense of place and olden Sydney.
Came here for high tea.
Lovely setting.
Staff were very attentive.
Majority of high tea treats were delicious.
A bit more cream for the scones wouldn't go astray.
Great value at $49 each which includes a glass of sparkling.
I would recommend this high tea to friends.
Went for high tea with my boyfriend and this is probably the worst high tea I'd been too.
The food wasn't very good.
The desserts were worse.
Everything looked nice but was bland and horrible.
One good thing about the high tea was the unlimited amount of tea you could refill.
You could try all the flavours and they have a wide range of tea selection which was really good!
I only tried like 3 and they were all nice.
The location was nice and we got to explore the historic area afterward which was good.
But yeah it was $50 a head soooooooo not worth it.
Went from bad to worse.....
Recently went to a kitchen tea at vaucluse house.
Beautiful location but that was the only thing that was nice.
Service was bad but the food served was even worse.
A child was given separate food to the adults and it was boring and burnt!
how hard is it to make plain pasta with just melted cheese on it?
The adults were served ravioli and they were disgusting as there was no sauce and raw so you couldn't even get it down your throat.
Definitely won't be going back and won't be recommending this place to anyone.
not enough staff for busy establishment
staff were rushed of there feet
Service was pretentious and not pleasant
Coffee weak no flavour little marinette
Fish snapper dish tasted funny
Vegetable serving ungenerous though nice the better part of the menu
What a disappointment!!.
Food really average and the service worse...
It started so promisingly, beautiful weather, very warm reception when we arrived and were seated.
The high tea was was so ordinary and unenjoyable - we left most of it and ordered an entree to eat.
That was after we finally managed to get a staff members attention.
Not easy to do.
It arrived but without cutlery and it took 15 mins to get the attention of another staff member.
By this time the entree was cold and also unenjoyable.
Would not have been so bad if the tea house had been super busy!!
Surprisingly a good cafe to get some burgers but they are not just good for burgers they have healthy choices and also great smoothies.
Worth a visit if you are in the area.
What a cool place.
Not only that but the food is tasty, the coffee was excellent and the staff are super friendly.
I had three middle eastern breakfast board which was sufficiently plentiful.
A few different items on the board to provide variety and when compiled altogether, an excellent flavour combination.
There are quite a few things on the menu.
So lots of choice.
From your typical items to things with a little flair.
The pastries on the counter also looked delightful.
The cafe is in a convenient location with easy access to parking.
Indoor and outdoor seating but I imagine if every table was occupied, it would feel quite full as the tables are close to each other.
The staff are really friendly and will have a chat like they’ve known you for ages.
It’s such a nice feel.
Will definitely come back here, especially for the coffee.
Whether you’re in the mood for breakfast or brunch, bar biscotti is honestly the place to be at.
Complement your feed with a side of their freshly made juice and your meal is good to go 😍👌🏽
My absolute favorite cafe...
The staff there are all so welcoming they make you feel like family... the food is also very lovely, never been disappointed..
Nothing but love
Menu is great unfortunately, SERVICE IS SLOW!!!!!
SO HARD TO GET SOMEONE TO TAKE OUR ORDER because the servers keep on chatting to their "favorite customers".
They simply ignored us!
If you want to enjoy your meal here, better be a favorite of the crew!
If you know me you know how picky I am with food.
After hearing from several different people about ‘ bar biscoti ‘ it was time to give it a try .
Nothing gives me more anxiety then trying to find parking , circling the block 50 times before finding a car spot 3 kms up the road , but that wasn’t the case here !!
Prime parking in a car park directly across the road no more than 30m away , It was already a win for me !
Sat down and greeted by the friendly staff , I ordered a double shot flat white with almond milk .
Temperature was spot on and coffee was how it should be .
Ordered a kale breakfast bowl and organic Bircher muesli .
Kale breakfast bowl was the best I have had , kale , broccoli poached eggs and added smoked salmon .
Perfect healthy meal to start the day .
The organic Bircher muesli , the seasonal fruit was fresh and crisp , crunchy Bircher muesli and tasty yoghurt .
Deffinetly the best I have had in a long time .
This will deffinetly be my new weekend breakfast spot in the area as it lived up to the hype .
Thanks guys and see yas again soon !
A lovely local place to have brunch!
Decided to come here for a post workout meal.
The menu is extensive enough to give me options but it’s not overwhelming.
The dishes all sound so wholesome, and you would expect to see a lot of the classic brunch dishes on this menu.
I ended up getting the kale breakfast bowl and for $17, it was very satisfying and I felt full afterwards!
All the ingredients were very fresh and tasty, I enjoyed every bite out of it.
Poached eggs on point.
It was a really beautiful day and wanted to sit outside, but it all the tables were occupied.
Nevertheless, the ambiance inside this cafe was very open and welcoming.
Will come back for more!
Now.
What makes a good eggs benedict is two things.
Runny yolk.
Nice hollandaise sauce.
Oh my god, literally said that as i cut into the egg.
Very disappointed.
Over cooked as hell.
Cmon, is it that hard to time the eggs?
I didnt think there was enough hollandaise sauce too.
Taste wise was good though.
Call me nitpicky, but overcooked yolks pretty much kills the dish.
Lots of fried bacon.
And another thing, i requested smoked salmon.
They got my order wrong.
Say what?
Friend had the trio rice with spatchcock and cucumber yoghurt.
He said it was okay.
Large hot chocolate included.
Service was good.
Location was bad.
Might i add that i came with a groupon voucher.
If i paid normally, i wouldnt be very happy sadly.
Dont recommend.
Love the atmosphere.
I like sitting inside because outside can get a little dusty.
Really friendly staff, fresh and yummy food.
Health conscious menu not only pretty to look at but also very tasty.
We ordered the big biscotti and breakfast plate which seemed quite similar but they were both delicious with generous servings.
Coffee was superb!
The breakfast board was quite underwhelming, had to order a couple sides in order to feel full.
Service was great and really welcoming, food was average.
The coffee on the other hand was great 👌🏼 would recommend for light eaters and coffee lovers ☕️
Came here for lunch on Sunday arvo, ordered  coffee and bruschetta.
Took ages for the food to come out, and when it finally did, it was cold.
Brushetta was served on godforsaken "crispy tortilla", which wasn't crispy at all and absolutely soaked in oil.
Main palate of the dish was just onions; with fragrant olive oil and basil, the very characteristics of bruschetta, nowhere to be seen.
Oh, and nothing was done correctly with this dish, including the poached eggs, which rubbery and overcooked.
The worse part was the manager "Mona" who refused to make any acknowledgement of the fault and snapped that it was their "signature dish".
PLEASE NEVER EAT HERE.

After an early morning visit to Flemington market, it's nice to be able to pull up a stool at the open window counter at the nearby Bar Biscotti to bask in the morning sun and enjoy a coffee by a bearded barista.
We had a great lunch here (salt and pepper calamari) with terrific service.
The coffee was fantastic too ... only thing I found odd ... they don't serve Biscotti.
Would recommend here equally for a catch up with friends or working lunch.
These guys are a great bunch, not only did they help direct me to another competing cafe but they also made a damn good skim cappuccino to get me through the sydney traffic.
Interior design was very cool.
Will return to try the food.
Yummy food and large portions.
Great styling with a lot of the old factory/industrial feel maintained.
Will definitely be going back for more of the breakfast options!
Chef knows what he is doing here.
Had the special of spatchcock.
Now whilst the bird wasn't huge, the accompanying salad and yoghurt and all that went in it made it delicious.
Friend ordered a chicken dish.
Said it was very moist.
Coffee could use a little improvement though.
Very weak.
Will return for the food.
Food is good but like the rest of the reviews, the service is terrible.
Twice I've been here and the service was slower each time.
My arms gets pretty tired from waving to get the attention of the waiters.
Perhaps the management should bring some basic school rules and confiscate their mobile phones so they can concentrate on serving their customers.
The breakfast is great here and staff are very friendly.
I ordered the Big Biscotti(=big breakfast), serving is in good portion with variaty type of food.
mom has the salsa bruschetta.
i like the dish as they did not use the normal sourdough bread.
the crunchy thin bread gives this dish a unique taste.
Sis has the smoked salmon and it is a little bit too salty.
good choice for brunch as well as for breakfast
Extensive menu, all day breakfast, open on public holiday, warm vibe from waiters.
However, they were overstretched and not able to accommodate the busy client load.
They took awhile to allow us to seat, said they will attend to us you give menu but didn't until we asked 10 minutes later.
They did not get to us for ordering until asked, the waiter clearly could not remember our orders but asked confirmation.
The order still was incorrect when they served, and when I alerted to the incorrect order and sought clarification, the waitress did not return?
The food was nice, though can be improved.
The service is what let them down.
Please take the orders on paper, and do not get distracted when se serving a customer, should go miles for this promising cafe.
It maybe just because of the extra clientele.
Lovely little spot, but unfortunately, mediocre food.
Got the Eggs Benedict with Smoke Salmon and it was rather disappointing.
The Bearnaise sauce was too sweet to go well with the salmon, and the toast was also burnt so the bitter after taste did not help.
I absolutely love the beautiful outdoor, escaping the city feel of this place.
You can sit in comfortable chairs in sun or shade surrounded by plants!
It has a diverse menu and there is nothing on it we have not enjoyed.
I particularly like the cinnamon porridge with rhubarb topper though.
Hope to make it back there to try out the cocktails soon.
Overall our favourite place for brunch in surry hills.
Nice outside seating area and really friendly service.
The bacon rolls are great too.
Great Vege brekkie!
Loved the spicy sauce that came with it and a huge serving.
Definitely hit the spot and the coffee was also on the money.
Nice outdoor setting which is great for a sunny day
Crown street is all over its self but Pieno is a rose within the hubub.
you simply have to see the generosity of the breakfasts, the welcoming of the staff.
Came here on Saturday morning and it was completely full.
We had to wait a few minutes for a table.
The waiters were very warm and friendly.
I ordered the avocado on toast, and my partner ordered the fruit with granola.
The avocado on toast cost $16, which is heaps expensive because it was quite a simple dish you could find at other cafes for $8.
Overall, food: okay, service: great, price: expensive.
I probably will not be back for a while.
Descent food, descent place, service is a bit intimidating but not bad.
Service is a bit intimidating.
Service is not bad.
Their quinoa soup and lamb salad are great , big portions too.
A bit overpriced.
the only thing i did not like is, one of their table is right in front of the toilet, which I think is not good as you do not want to smell the toilet while eating.
I have not eaten any food in here yet,but oh boy the coffee!!!!
After drinking their coffee last month at least once a week (twice in a day somedays :0 ) it is safe to say 'BEST COFFEE in SYDNEY'!
They use '5 Senses' Dark Horse blend which is to die for if you like that kick in your coffee.
Big breakfast was good.
The chutney was a perfect match and everything was flavoursome.
One tiny gripe is that the sourdough bread has a big hole in the middle so we did not end up with much bread at all but otherwise, everything was delicious
If you have been to The Winery, you must have walked pass this cafe.
That is how I first noticed.
After having been to pretty much every other brunch spots on Crown Street, we decided to give this place a try.
Menu did not strike me as very exciting, I settled on the chicken sandwich and a cup of skim latte.
It was a super simple sandwich with sad looking grilled veggies and chicken breast.
It was so dry!
Even with mayo, it was still very dry, coupled with average sandwich bread.
It did not come across as cafe quality but something you and I could easily rustle up at home.
Coffee was ok but you could get ok coffee anywhere in Surry Hills.
It was not a quite satisfying and impressive meal, I very much doubt there would be second time.
Came here for coffee and something to eat!
I ordered the chargrilled chicken sandwich.
Unfortunately the chicken tasted bland and wasn't chargrilled at all...
The bread and chicken together made the entire sandwich dry...
It was lacking sauce and flavour.
Was very disappointed with my experience here..
The service was quite poor as well.
The location however, is beautiful and has a very relaxing vibe to it.
Great coffee.
Good food.
Brilliant spot.
Terrible terrible terrible service.
I guess the owners do not need to bother though considering the location.
There is a lot of this in Sydney.
Pieno is a Surry Hills institution.
It is always packed with beautiful people.
They do an all day breakfast which definitely caters to the locals.
The food is a little highly priced but beautiful.
The service is ok, they are not overly pushy which is nice.
It is a great place to go for a leisurely lunch and a glass or two of wine.
We had 2 of the current specials, Eggs Benedict and Vodka flavored salad, and both meals were very tasty.
Definitely worth going, if you can get a table.
I have always walked past this place and seen it packed.
I came on a fairly quiet hot day and enjoyed a chipotle chicken salad and banana smoothie outside.
Pleasant atmosphere and okay service.
Came for lunch at about 230 and there were only a few tables taken.
After not receiving any acknowledgment I went to the counter to ask about service and he asked us to order at the counter.
I think it is usually table service.
Anyhow we only wanted something small and decided to share a burger.
Lucky we did as they were quite generous.
Besides the poor service the good was delicious.
Went there for breakfast after taking a break from this place for a while.
It was disappointments after disappointments.
The coffees ordered came with the soy milk completely curdled; and temperature borderline boiling.
After giving us a dodgy explanation for that we decided to order food.
I ordered Avocado and Coriander on toast from the menu.
What arrived was certainly avocado but  I could not find any substantial amount of coriander.
The avocado had been covered with a disgusting thickened vinegar.
It was simply disgusting.
What could have been a refreshing/delicate dish was actually something that should not leave the kitchen and be advertised on their menu.
My friend had the green eggs (omelette) that were overcooked and tasted like cardboard.
Overall, we gave it one last chance but it certainly did not raise to the occasion.
With so many fantastic cafés in Surry Hills, this one is certainly one I would not recommend to anybody.
Haven't eaten here.
The cafe looks great with an abundance of outdoor seating.
I usually come for the coffee when I am in this part of Surry Hills.
They do fantastic coffee using 5 senses beans.
First time here for breakfast, ordered extra hot coffee, came warm, ordered mushroom bruschetta, mushrooms were cold.
Almost like they had been pre cooked, stored in fridge, although there was steam coming from them, they were cold.
Husband had the big breakfast which was cold as well, sausage wasn't nice at all.
Very disappointing.
Love it!.
I love coming here! The staff are super friendly, the coffee is good and the breakfast is great!
Best part is you can sit out in the sun or sit hidden away down the side.
I love the chicken sandwiches, they are fantastic!
Have been a regular at Cafe Pieno for 3 or so years but giving it a wide berth after last few visits.
Food quality gone bad: frugal serves of salmon and poached eggs, and what is with the soft mash "rosti", and tomatoes not even roasted?
Badly chipped plates and coffee cups should be replaced but still in service, indifferent unfriendly service.
Final straw was neither of the toilets were working today (in past were often not clean/tidy).
There are much better places in Surry Hills for weekend brunch.
